title: Which is the best Linux distro according to you??

comments.body: All the experienced ones out there are gonna say Arch.
C'mon don't be silly, everyone knows the right answer is [Hannah Montana Linux](https://hannahmontana.sourceforge.net/)
In love with fedora. Stable and up to date. Tbh tho distro dosent matter atp with Distribox and docker being a thing now you can debian stable on your laptop and use arch on Distribox.

Mint for me!
Been using it as my daily for over 2 yrs..
Whichever u use make sure to dual boot the os instead of using a virtual machine . Otherwise u will face some hardware related issues

If you are starting off then ubuntu if thats only OS you wanna run on the system or Lubuntu if you mostly focus on just learning the commands and also as a vm. You also have the option of wsl in windows for practicing commands..
